column1: These are only mutations which promote immunity scape

column7: Immune Escape Properties
resistance to neutralizing antibodies and could weaken the hydrogen bond and hydrophobic interaction; strengthened resistance to class 1 antibodies (Liu et al.)
D614G improves infectivity but not necessarily antigenicity
D339H likely reduced neutralization of BA.2.86 (Qu et al.)
reduces antibody neutralization
conferred resistance to each of four convalescent sera tested
conferred resistance to each of four convalescent sera tested

reduces antibody neutralization titers - any of the changes at E484 (K, Q, or P) in SARS-CoV-2, negative to positive amino acid change, negative to positive change; E484K reduces NAbs binding in Omicron (Cui et al.); onsiderable loss of neutralizing activity of convalescent sera and mAb (Zabidi et. al., 2023)
reduces neutralization by mAb 2489
F490L resistant to some antibodies and may erode the hydrophobic interaction between molecules; F456L increases neutralization resistance in KP.2 lineage (Wang et al.)

escaped 3 out of 4 sera - SARS-CoV-2 (Harvey et al.); F490S reduced susceptibility to neturalizing Abs and F486S increases neutralization resistance of Abs (Zabidi et al.); F59S reduced neutralization for the XEC variant (Li et al.)
escaped 3 out of 4 sera - SARS-CoV-2; G339D associated with escape from a subset of NAbs (Zabidi et al.)
G496S antibody evasion of Omicron; G446S reduced neutralization; G446S contributes to neutralization resistance of Abs generated from exisiting vaccines (Zabidi et al.)
escaped 3 out of 4 sera - SARS-CoV-2; reduction in neutralization (Greaney et al.)
escaped 3 out of 4 of the tested sera - SARS-CoV-2; resistant to some antibodies (Liu et al., 2021)

K417N resulted in a -27 fold reduction in neutralization by mAb COVOX-40; K417N alters the key interactions with class I NAbs leading to immune evasion (Zabidi et al.); K444N resistant to some mAbs (Liu et al.)
neutral to positive charge change; unable to find something definitive on this change
positive to neutral charge change; K444R resistant to neutralization by vaccinated sera (Wang et al.)
K444T reduces potency of class III antibodies; K356T enhances immune escape of pseudoviruses (Bdeir et al.)
escape of numerous NTD binding mAbs; L455F confers some immune escape (Focosi et al.)
L452R escaped 3 out of 4 sera - SARS-CoV-2; resistance to some antibodies; L441R resistant to some polyclonal human immune sera (Liu et al.)
N450D resistant to some polyclonal human immune sera (Liu et al.)

large antigenic effect (influenza); responsible for cluster transitions in 12 pairs of strains with an average antigenic distance between the pairs of 4.0 units - WHO recommends vaccine strain updates with a distance of 2; neutral to positive charge change; N439K significantly alters neutralization by polyclonal antibodies in SARS-CoV-2; N440K reduces neutralization (Cui); N440K confers high resistance to certain mAbs (Zabidi et al.); N450K resistant to some mAbs (Liu et al.); N460K reduces neutralization (Ao et al.; Ma et al.)
resistant to antibody neutralization
reduces neutralization of RBD antibodies; results in conformational changes; N501Y reduces NAb binding in Omicron variant; N450Y resistant to some polyclonal human immune sera (Liu et al.)
P681H enhances virus' ability to evade innate immune responses (Jose Lista et al.)
resistant to some mAbs (Liu et al.)
Q677H increases neutralization resistance
R346K reduces binding of the antibodies with RBD (Zabidi et al.)
conferred resistance to 2 out of 4 sera tested - SARS-CoV-2 (Harvey et al.); resistant to some mAbs (Liu et al.)

S477N change resistant to panel of RBD targeting mAbs; "persisted at a frequency of between 4% and 7% of sequences globally since mid-June 2020" (Harvey); reduces neutralization in Omicron; S446N enhances immune evasion (Liu et al.)

I find mix reviews about this, nothing specific about the change but the site yes; some studies state that it may reduce neutralization but then others say this is due to binding affinity or its no greater than WT (Harvey)
impact antigenicity (Harvey et al.); yielded resistance to a few mAbs (Liu et al.); T572I slight bolster to immune evasion

mutation of the Delta variant, more likely to undergo secondary mutation (?) in low titer antibody  environment leading to decreased neutralization - SARS-CoV-2; substantially impairs NAb binding (Cui et al.); increases electrostatic potential and interferes with spike RBD interaction with convalescent sera contributing to immune evasion (Zabidi et al.)
cluster difference substitution for the HK68-EN72 transition in influenza with an antigenic distance of 3.4
resistant to neutralizing antibodies
loss of reactivity to anti-NTD neutralizing antibodies (Kubik et al.)
reduces neutralization by mAbs
Y505H reduces neutralization in Omicron variant; neutral to positive charge change; Y449H of the C.1.2 variant was resistant to neutralization (Tada et al.)
Q439R key immune escape site in Omicron, resistance to Class I-III antibodies ; Q498R reduces neutralization in Omicron variant
greater resistance to neutralizing antibodies

greater resistance to neutralizing antibodies; S494P reduces antibody neutralization of convalescent and post-immunization sera, particularly when combined with E484K and N501Y; S494P reduces neutralization (Chakraborty)
column8: Cui et al., 2022 (10.1016/j.cell.2022.01.019); Alenquer et al., 2021 (https://doi.org/10.1101/2021.04.22.441007) - PREPRINT; Chakraborty, 2022 (https://doi.org/10.1016/j.intimp.2021.108424)

column7: greater resistance to neutralizing antibodies
immune escape; L452Q reduces neutralization of several mAbs
R346T reduces neutralizing efficacy of vaccine generated Abs; though some source says it only has a minimal impact neutralization (Wang et al.)
resistant against one tested polyclonal human immune sera
A435S reduces neutralization potency of Class I and Class 1/4 in XEC lineage
reduced antibody binding in Omicron sublineages (Stein et al.)
increased immune escape of the XBB.1.5 variant
increased evasion of antibodies in XBB lineage (Ao et al.)
reduces antibody neutralization titers - any of the changes at E484 (K, Q, or P) in SARS-CoV-2; E484Q reduced sensitivity to vaccine-elicited neutralizing antibodies (Ferreira et al.)
column8: Harvey et al., 2021 (https://doi.org/10.1038/s41579-021-00573-0); Ferreira et al., 2021 (10.1093/infdis/jiab368)

column7: R346S reduced neutralization of some NAbs (Yi et al.)
F490V reduced neutralization of some NAbs (Yi et al.); F486V reduced senstivity to neutralization (Pastorio et al.)
